data_table.name: outc_strk_carotid_cad_rel4
data_table.description: Outcomes - Stroke/Carotid Artery Disease (Form 121/132), data for Calcium and Vitamin D (CaD) Trial

variable.comment: Carotid Artery Disease was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. Carotid Areter Disease occurring on or after a Stroke is not counted.
Carotid Artery Disease was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. Carotid Areter Disease occurring on or after a Stroke is not counted.
Carotid Artery Disease was adjudicated for CT and OS participants through Ext1. Carotid Areter Disease occurring on or after a Stroke is not counted.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates a hemorrhagic stroke. Hemorrhagic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates a hemorrhagic stroke. Hemorrhagic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates a hemorrhagic stroke. Hemorrhagic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates an iscemic stroke. Ischemic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates an iscemic stroke. Ischemic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as a Stroke where the diagnosis question indicates an iscemic stroke. Ischemic Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. Form 121 and early versions of 132 were not able to record Hemorrhagic/Ischemic classification for procedure related Strokes. See the Stroke Diagnosis variable for more detail.

Defined as the first occurrence of Stroke or a Death due to Cerebrovascular. Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. In order to be able to classify strokes, WHI uses central adjudications if possible, even though Strokes were only fully centrally adjudicated in HT participants. This file does not include Strokes determined solely by the cause of death.

Defined as the first occurrence of Stroke or a Death due to Cerebrovascular. Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. In order to be able to classify strokes, WHI uses central adjudications if possible, even though Strokes were only fully centrally adjudicated in HT participants. This file does not include Strokes determined solely by the cause of death.

Defined as the first occurrence of Stroke or a Death due to Cerebrovascular. Stroke is adjudicated for CT and OS participants. In order to be able to classify strokes, WHI uses central adjudications if possible, even though Strokes were only fully centrally adjudicated in HT participants. This file does not include Strokes determined solely by the cause of death.
Value 6 was only on form 121 and early versions of form 132. Strokes with a diagnosis code of 6 were unable to be classified as Hemorrhagic or Ischemic.
Value 6 was only on form 121 and early versions of form 132. Strokes with a diagnosis code of 6 were unable to be classified as Hemorrhagic or Ischemic.
Value 6 was only on form 121 and early versions of form 132. Strokes with a diagnosis code of 6 were unable to be classified as Hemorrhagic or Ischemic.

variable.description: Stroke occurred during or resulted from a procedure
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of F132. A stroke is defined as procedure-related if it occurs within 24 hours after any procedure or within 30 days after a cardioversion or invasive cardiovascular procedure.

variable.description: Stroke occurred during or resulted from a procedure
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of F132. A stroke is defined as procedure-related if it occurs within 24 hours after any procedure or within 30 days after a cardioversion or invasive cardiovascular procedure.

variable.description: Stroke occurred during or resulted from a procedure
variable.comment: Not collected on early versions of F132. A stroke is defined as procedure-related if it occurs within 24 hours after any procedure or within 30 days after a cardioversion or invasive cardiovascular procedure.

variable.description: F132 Stroke diagnosed or managed as outpatient
variable.comment:
Was the stroke diagnosed or managed as an outpatient?* _x000D_
*The outpatient setting includes any emergency department or observation unit, short hospital stays of less than 24 hours duration or a direct admission to a rehab facility without an associated admission to an acute care hospital. Only collected after WHI closeout.

variable.description: F132 Stroke diagnosed or managed as outpatient
variable.comment:
Was the stroke diagnosed or managed as an outpatient?* _x000D_
*The outpatient setting includes any emergency department or observation unit, short hospital stays of less than 24 hours duration or a direct admission to a rehab facility without an associated admission to an acute care hospital. Only collected after WHI closeout.

variable.description: F132 Stroke diagnosed or managed as outpatient
variable.comment:
Was the stroke diagnosed or managed as an outpatient?* _x000D_
*The outpatient setting includes any emergency department or observation unit, short hospital stays of less than 24 hours duration or a direct admission to a rehab facility without an associated admission to an acute care hospital. Only collected after WHI closeout.

Trial of Org 10172 in Acute Stroke Treatment (TOAST) Classification A 'probable' diagnosis is made if the clinical findings, neuroimaging data, and results of diagnostic studies are consistent with one subtype and other etiologies have been excluded. A 'possible' diagnosis is made when the clinical findings and neuroimaging data suggest a specific subtype but other studies are not done.

stats.example: Stroke undetermined two or more causes identified
Probable stroke of other determined etiology
